title: Why do humans sleep and not hibernate? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t rightly know, but I suspect that this is because our metabolism does not require hibernation: we do not subsist solely off of a food source which experiences reliable seasonal scarcity. … I could suggest that hibernation would be an evolutionary disaster for humans, unable to otherwise defend themselves… but that is nonsense; many prey animals hibernate and they can’t “defend” themselves either. If humans needed to hibernate, we’d have been able to design suitable fortification against predation. Whether we’d ever have evolved big brains and such is obviously unknown, but I don’t believe that it would have happened. Hibernation does not accomplish what sleep does, and animals that hibernate also sleep. Hibernation is not a “sleep” concern, it is primarily a metabolic concern.
